supporting_spans: Monsieur de Villefort had scarcely said this, when the door opened, and Barrois appeared.
M. Noirtier was sitting in an armchair, which moved upon casters, in which he was wheeled into the room in the morning, and in the same way drawn out again at night.
contradicting_spans: M. Noirtier was sitting in an armchair, which moved upon casters, in which he was wheeled into the room in the morning, and in the same way drawn out again at night.
reasoning: Evidence supports: These excerpts show that Villefort's political views were a source of tension between him and his father, and that their conversations about politics often took place during family gatherings.

analysis.claim_text: Villefort’s drift toward the royalists disappointed him; father and son argued politics at every family gathering.

sub_claims.text: Villefort’s drift toward the royalists disappointed him.
father and son argued politics at every family gathering.
